Title: Kingdom Centre Sky Bridge
Description: Iconic skyscraper with a dramatic sky bridge offering panoramic views of Riyadh—especially magical at sunset.

Title: Al Masmak Palace (Masmak Fortress)
Description: 19th-century mudbrick fort central to Saudi history, now a museum showcasing artifacts of the Battle of Riyadh and early Saudi state.

Title: National Museum of Saudi Arabia
Description: Extensive exhibits tracing Arabia from prehistoric times to modern Saudi; vibrant and educational.

Title: Murabba Palace (King Abdulaziz Historical Centre)
Description: Former royal residence and administrative centre (1938–1953), now a museum housing arts, archives and King Abdulaziz memorabilia.

Title: Diriyah / At‑Turaif World Heritage Site
Description: The historic birthplace of the first Saudi state, with mud‑brick palaces, light‑and‑sound evenings, plus nearby Bujairi Terrace restaurants and cafés.

Title: Al Bujairi Heritage Park & Bujairi Terrace
Description: Scenic evening-filled gathering spot in Diriyah—filled with cafés, restaurants and views of heritage architecture.

Title: Edge of the World
Description: Dramatic cliff overlooking endless desert—famous for hiking, Jeep tours and sunset views ~100 km outside Riyadh.

Title: Wadi Hanifa
Description: A green valley cutting through Riyadh—great for picnicking, walking and peaceful urban nature.

Title: VIA Riyadh
Description: New luxury lifestyle hub built in Salmani architectural style—boutiques, art, restaurants and cinemas in a vibrant cultural complex.

Title: Boulevard Riyadh City
Description: Large outdoor entertainment zone with water shows, dining and attractions; frequented in Riyadh Season.

Title: Riyadh TV Tower
Description: Tall broadcast tower and landmark from 1980s; visible from much of the city.

Title: Diplomatic Quarter & Le Maschou (restaurant)
Description: Diplomatic Quarter known for leafy hiking paths; fine‑dining like Le Maschou offers exquisite French cuisine in elegant setting.

Title: Souk Al‑Zal
Description: Historic marketplace selling antiques, local crafts, oud, perfumes and Saudi souvenirs.

Title: Takya at Bujairi Terrace
Description: Saudi-contemporary fusion dining inside Diriyah’s Bujairi Terrace—modern twist on local flavours.

Title: Robata at The Canopy
Description: Robata‑style Japanese grill restaurant in Riyadh’s trendy The Canopy district.

Title: Beit Omar
Description: Quality Lebanese cuisine in a refined setting on Tahlia Street, a popular upscale district.

Title: Red Sand Dunes & Monster‑truck
Description: Red dunes near Riyadh where you can rent monster‑truck or go dune‑bashing; local fun.

Title: Riyadh Zoo
Description: Large city zoo featuring animals from around the world; a favorite for families and kids.

Title: Salam Park
Description: Sprawling urban park with a lake, walking trails, paddle boats, and picnic spots.

Title: Al Rajhi Grand Mosque
Description: One of the largest mosques in Riyadh; known for its impressive Islamic architecture.

Title: Sky Shopping Mall
Description: Modern mall with a variety of retail outlets, eateries, and indoor entertainment for kids.

Title: Riyadh Season (Winter Wonderland)
Description: Annual entertainment and cultural festival featuring concerts, rides, dining, and exhibits.

Title: Janadriyah Cultural Festival
Description: Saudi Arabia’s most prominent heritage and cultural festival showcasing crafts, cuisine and folklore.

Title: Riyadh Front Exhibition & Conference Center
Description: Trendy mixed-use development with top restaurants, pop-ups and seasonal events.

Title: Imam Turki Bin Abdullah Grand Mosque
Description: A majestic mosque near the historic Al Masmak area, known for its beautiful design.

Title: King Abdullah Park
Description: Well-kept park with a large dancing fountain show, gardens, and kids play area.

Title: World Sights Park
Description: Park featuring miniature replicas of famous world landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and Taj Mahal.

Title: Tuwaiq Palace
Description: Award-winning architectural marvel in the Diplomatic Quarter; often used for official receptions and cultural events.

Title: Al Faisaliah Tower
Description: One of Riyadh’s tallest buildings, housing a globe-shaped restaurant and a luxury mall.

Title: The National Library of Saudi Arabia
Description: Modern cultural hub offering exhibitions, reading areas, and rare Islamic manuscripts.

Title: Heet Cave
Description: Hidden natural cave with a crystal-clear underground lake—perfect for experienced hikers and explorers.

Title: Naila Art Gallery

Title: Granada Mall

Title: U Walk Riyadh

Title: Al Watan Park

Title: King Fahad Cultural Centre
